enWisdom: The liar is disgraced and humiliated
Lying is disgrace and treachery (and regret)
A liar is at the brink of an abyss [of ruin] and disgrace
Lying destroys the one who accompanies it and saves the one who eschews it

Wisdom: الْكَذِبُ فِي الْعَاجِلَةِ عَارٌ وَفِي الْآجِلَةِ [الْآخِرَةِ] عَذَابُ النَّارِ
enWisdom: Lying is [a cause of] disgrace in this world and [leads one to] hellfire in the Hereafter

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْكَذِبِ الْمَهَانَةُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْعَذَابُ فِي الْآخِرَةِ
enWisdom: The fruit of lying is disgrace in this world and chastisement in the Hereafter
Lying is the corruption of [one’s] prestige
One whose lying increases, his prestige decreases

Wisdom: مِنْ مَهَانَةِ الْكَذَّابِ جُودُهُ [الْجُودُ] بِالْيَمِينِ لِغَيْرِ مُسْتَحْلِفٍ
enWisdom: From the disgrace of the incessant liar is his readiness to swear [that he is truthful] for one who does not [even] ask him to swear
